place.name: EDINGLEY
place.gazetteerText: EDINGLEY, a parish in Southwell district, Notts; near the source of the river Greet, 3 miles WN W of Southwell r. station. Post town, Southwell. Acres, 1,800. Real property, £3, 099. Pop., 390. Houses, 88. The property is much subdivided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £51. Patrons, the Chapter of Southwell. The chancel of the church was rebuilt, and the rest of the edifice repaired in 1844. A school has £15 from endowment; and other charities £14. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
